org.bladerunnerjs.plugin

Interface ContentPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    OrderedPlugin, Plugin
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractContentPlugin, AliasingContentPlugin, AppMetadataContentPlugin, CommonJsContentPlugin, CompositeJsContentPlugin, CssContentPlugin, CssResourceContentPlugin, HTMLContentPlugin, I18nContentPlugin, NamespacedJsContentPlugin, ThirdpartyContentPlugin, UnbundledResourcesContentPlugin, VirtualProxyContentPlugin, XMLContentPlugin

    public interface ContentPlugin
extends OrderedPlugin

    Content plug-ins allow generated content to be returned by the application server in response to requests from the web browser. Where content plug-ins differ from similar mechanisms employed on most other application servers is that they are required to support flat-file export, and so must therefore have the following properties:

    Determinism
    The same response must always be returned given the same request and the same set of files on disk.
    Discoverability
    The complete list of valid content paths must be provided by content plug-ins on demand (using getValidDevContentPaths()), such that any requests from the browser that are not included in this list are considered to be an error.

    Although content-plugins are designed to be usable both dynamically, and as part of a build (for flat-file export), a provision for generating different content in development and production is provided, for cases where things need to be done in a more efficient manner in production, and in a more dev-friendly manner in development. Developers that choose to exploit this facility should take care to ensure there is no chance of bugs being found in production, that can't also be observed in development; a core tenet of BladeRunnerJS.

    The following methods are identifier-methods, and may be invoked before Plugin.setBRJS() has been invoked:

    • getRequestPrefix()
    • getCompositeGroupName()

    • Method Detail

      • getRequestPrefix

        java.lang.String getRequestPrefix()
        Returns the prefix that all requests for this content plug-in will begin with.

        Note: Developers should not rely on any class initialization performed within Plugin.setBRJS() as this method is an identifier-method which may be invoked before Plugin.setBRJS() has itself been invoked.

      • getCompositeGroupName

        java.lang.String getCompositeGroupName()
        Returns the group name of content plug-in, which allow composite content plug-ins that compose a number of related plug-ins.

        Note: Developers should not rely on any class initialization performed within Plugin.setBRJS() as this method is an identifier-method which may be invoked before Plugin.setBRJS() has itself been invoked.

        Returns:
        the group name if one exists, or null otherwise.

      • getContentPathParser

        ContentPathParser getContentPathParser()
        Returns the content-path parser that will be used to parse all requests for this plug-in.

        Although the parsing mechanism used by content plug-ins could be an internal implementation detail within each class, by exposing it we make it possible to create requests for external content plug-ins that are less brittle to change.

      • handleRequest

        ResponseContent handleRequest(ParsedContentPath contentPath,
                              BundleSet bundleSet,
                              UrlContentAccessor contentAccessor,
                              java.lang.String version)
                       throws ContentProcessingException
        Get a reader for the content generated for the given request.
        Parameters:
        contentPath - The parsed content path created using the content path parser available from getContentPathParser().
        bundleSet - The bundle-set for the bundlable node to which this request is related to.
        contentAccessor - The output stream the content will be written to.
        version - TODO
        Throws:
        ContentProcessingException - if a problem is encountered.

      • getValidContentPaths

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getValidContentPaths(BundleSet bundleSet,
                                                      RequestMode requestMode,
                                                      Locale... locales)
                                               throws ContentProcessingException
        Returns the list of valid content paths for the given bundle-set and locale.
        Parameters:
        bundleSet - The bundle-set for which content paths must be generated.
        requestMode - An enum representing the 'mode' for this request - either dev or prod.
        locales - The locale for which content paths must be generated.
        Throws:
        ContentProcessingException - if a problem is encountered.

      • getUsedContentPaths

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUsedContentPaths(BundleSet bundleSet,
                                                     RequestMode requestMode,
                                                     Locale... locales)
                                              throws ContentProcessingException
        Throws:
        ContentProcessingException
